meanings.definition: The act of changing the zoning regulations of an area to allow for less dense development.
meanings.sent1: The downzoning of the neighborhood led to fewer tall buildings.
meanings.sent2: The city council approved the downzoning to reduce overcrowding.
meanings.sent3: The downzoning decision made the town feel more spacious and peaceful.
meanings.sent4: Downzoning transformed the area into a quiet haven away from the city bustle.
meanings.sent5: The downzoning process made the streets less crowded and more serene.

meanings.definition: To rezone an area to restrict the types of buildings or land uses allowed.
meanings.sent1: The city decided to downzone the commercial district to prevent high-rise construction.
meanings.sent2: Residents petitioned the council to downzone the park to protect the natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The mayor jokingly threatened to downzone the entire town to only allow treehouses.
meanings.sent4: Downzoning the waterfront area felt like putting a fence around a garden.
meanings.sent5: The decision to downzone the historic district preserved its charm for future generations.
